events.title: First Step
events.description: Diego, Emilio, Gerardo y Sebastián won first place in Rescue Maze at TMR 2015, Mexico City.

events.title: First International
events.description: Diego, Emilio, Gerardo y Sebastián were the first to place Mexico in the Top 10 in RoboCup Jr. Rescue Maze in Hefei, China.

events.title: Team Foundation
events.description: Team founders decided to create a program to teach the basics of robotics to Tec freshmen and then have an internal competition to find the best fit for the team. This event has become our annual “Candidates”

events.title: Regional 2016
events.description: Javier, Alex, Nestor and Christian won 1st Place in Rescue Maze Regional. Cinthia, Eduardo, Cardozo and Ian won 1st in Soccer Open.

events.title: TMR 2016
events.description: 1st and 2nd Place in Rescue Maze TMR 2016, Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, by Javier, Alex, Nestor, Christian, and Tomas, Diego, Enrique, Isabela and Melissa.

events.title: Germany, Rescue Maze
events.description: Javier, Alex, Nestor and Cristian participated in RoboCup Rescue Maze.

events.title: Candidates 2016
events.description: The Candidates 2016 program was made, where 15 students joined the team.

events.title: LARC 2016
events.description: Diego, Clara, Emilio, Gerardo and Sebastián won 2nd Place in Latin American Robotics Competition IEEE Open Challenge.

events.title: Regional 2017
events.description: Tomas, Esquer, and Bernardo won 1st place in Rescue Maze. Angel, Ernesto, Gabriela, Ivan and Paul won 3rd place in Soccer Open and Cinthia, Aurora, Ana, Arcelia and Greg won 3rd in Soccer Light.

events.title: TMR 2017
events.description: Tomas, Esquer and Bernardo won 1st and Mariano, Alexis, Ernesto and Osvaldo won 2nd place in Rescue Maze.

events.title: Japan, Rescue Maze
events.description: Placing Mexico for the first time in the podium, Tomas, Alexis, Esquer and Ernesto won 3rd place in RoboCup Jr. Rescue Maze, Nagoya, Japan.

events.title: Candidates 2017
events.description: The Candidates 2017 program was made, where 15 students joined the team.

events.title: LARC 2017
events.description: Alex, Cardozo, Clara, Emilio, Javier and Nestor won 3rd place by a difference of 2pts in LARC IEEE Open.

events.title: TMR 2018
events.description: Alberto Jahuey, Itzel López, Ricardo Osorio and Yulisa Farron won 1st Place in Rescue Maze; Alberto López, Greg Espinosa, and Iqui Balam won 2nd in Soccer Open; Eric Uriel, Jesus Anaya, Isaac, Monica Nava and Roberto Galindo won 3rd in Soccer Light.

events.title: TMR 2018 Drones
events.description: Alex Garza, Aurora Tijerina, Cristian Bentin and Paul Vazquez won 3rd and was the first time participating in Autonomous Drones Advanced Category, at Tec of Monterrey, Campus Monterrey.

events.title: Canada, Rescue Maze & Soccer Open
events.description: Alberto, Greg and Iqui were the first ones to participate in Soccer Open internationally and Jahuey, Itzeld, Osorio and Yulisa participated in Rescue Maze in Montreal, Canada.

events.title: Candidates 2018
events.description: The Candidates 2018 program was made, where 12 students joined the team.

events.title: LARC 2018
events.description: 1st place in Latin American and Brazilian Competition IEEE Open Challenge won by Alexis, Antonio, Ivan, Mariano, and Osvaldo. The robot consisted of an autonomous car with a mechanism to grab metal blocks with magnets, along with a navigation and vision system to be able to leave the blocks in their corresponding places.

events.title: Formalization of @Home
events.description: The RoBorregos’ @HOME team was formalized. The team was divided into different technology areas, integrating voice recognition, natural language processing and computer vision with neural networks, navigation, control and mechanical and structural design.

events.title: Regional 2019
events.description: Amin, Chapa, Pasquel and Omar won 1st place in Soccer Light Category.

events.title: TMR 2019
events.description: Arath, Aldo, Jamir, and Juan Carlos won 1st place in Rescue Maze Category.

events.title: ICPC 2019
events.description: Cisneros, Ju√°rez and Mike participated in the regional tournament of the International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC).

events.title: Australia, Rescue Maze
events.description: Arath, Aldo, Jamir and Mauricio obtained the “Best Hardware Solution” award on the RoboCup Jr. Rescue Maze in Sydney Australia.

events.title: Candidates 2019
events.description: The Candidates 2019 program was made, where 12 students joined the team.

events.title: LARC OPEN 2019
events.description: During the semester, a robot was developed for the LARC IEEE competition, Open category. The robot consisted of an autonomous car with a mechanism to grab metal blocks by means of electromagnets, along with a navigation and vision system to be able to leave the blocks in their corresponding places. In the end, we could not attend due to economic issues.

events.title: 1st Gen Grad
events.description: Founders Diego, Emilio, Gerardo and Sebastian graduated.

events.title: Regional 2020
events.description: Diego, Emérico, Marlon and Grecia won 2nd place in Rescue Maze and Keven, Gabriela y Karyme won 3rd place in Soccer Lightweight.

events.title: Covid-19 Response
events.description: Unfortunately, both the TMR and Robocup Jr. were cancelled for this year, yet we continued working, creating online courses and webinars as well as participating in different tech events.

events.title: 1st participation in Conexión Tec
events.description: The team participated in the 13th Edition of Conexión Tec, showing their progress in speech recognition, navigation, computer vision and elevator mechanics for the @Home service robot.

events.title: Grads June 2020
events.description: Clara, Alex, Javi, Nestor, Gallo and Cardozo graduated.

events.title: First Candidates for all semesters
events.description: In this year the team had enough projects to accept students of all ages, creating challenges for beginners and advanced students in mechanics, electronics, and programming. Everything was made 100% online, accepting 14 students of different semesters and majors.

events.title: First generation of IEEE LARC VSSS
events.description: We started developing a new competition: the IEEE Very Small Size Soccer, where three 7 cm^3 robots play against another 3 robots in a football soccer match, implementing their control algorithm and pathfinding strategy based on the computation given by the computer vision system.

events.title: Formalization of SEMS: Social and Environmental Monitoring System
events.description: The team started a project that generates hard data on relevant factors that impact the health of the Tec community through a monitoring system, which would be later be implemented in all Tec campuses.

events.title: Grads December 2020
events.description: Neto, Tommy and Gaby graduated.

events.title: Formalization of Smart Factory
events.description: Smart Factory is the first investigation project of the team, reviewing new areas such as multirobot logistics and communication, smart storages and industrial production.

events.title: TMR @HOME Beginners
events.description: José Cisneros, Aldo, Chapa, Iqui and Aurora participated in @HOME Beginners, organized by the FMR. Even though it was a virtual event with no awarding we managed to get the computer vision and natural language understanding challenges with the highest score possible!

events.title: 1st place in Conexión Tec
events.description: We participated with the SEMS, @HOME, VSSS and Smart Factory proyects; The SEMS team obtained first place in the cathegory "Software prototype"

events.title: Grads June 2021
events.description: Aurora, Osvaldo, Alexis, Pacheco, Anita, Mariano and Paul graduated.

events.title: ICPC 2022
events.description: Cisneros, Ju√°rez and Mike's second participation in the regional tournament of the International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC).

events.title: @HOME simulation - IROS Japan
events.description: Aldo, Cisneros, Kevin, Bryan and Edison won 3rd place in Handyman challenge and 5th place overall.

events.title: Gala FETEC
events.description: RoBorregos won the award for greatest student impact at the FETEC Gala, an award given to groups that stand out for having an integral performance, establishing a solid team with excellent execution of events.

events.title: Ana Avatar Xprize
events.description: Kevin and Cisneros under the direction of Professor Mu√±oz participated in the Ana Avatar Xprize, which consists of creating a robotic avatar system that can transport human presence to a remote location in real time.

events.title: Tec Science Summit
events.description: Iv√°n and Cisneros participated in the Tec Science Summit 2023 presenting the @Home project.

events.title: Regional 2023
events.description: Ale, Paco and √Ångel won 2nd place in Soccer Lightweight. Yair, Jordan, Diego and Oscar won 3rd place in Rescue Maze.

events.title: TMR 2023
events.description: 1st place in LARC Open, 3rd place and winner of the technical challenge in Soccer Lightweight, best mechanics in Rescue Maze and first time participating in Home Major

events.title: Grads June 2023
events.description: Lore, Cisneros, Aldo, Mike, Jamir, Chapa, Em√©rico, Rosalba, Anel, Bryan, Kevin, Ruiz, Mau, Keven and Gaby graduated.
